桚字的基本解释

桚
zā
古同“拶”。

桚
zǎn
古同“拶”。

桚字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zǎn］
［《集韻》子末切，入曷，精。］
同“拶2”。
旧时酷刑之一，即拶指。用绳串联五根小木棍，套入受刑人手指而用力紧收。亦指这种刑具。
[②]［zā］
［《集韻》子末切，入曷，精。］
同“拶1”。
谓挤迫。

桚字的康熙字典解释

【補遺】【辰集】【木字部】　桚； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页526第21
【字彙補】音未詳。人名。宋時賜隴桚姓名曰趙懷恩。見《宋史新編·王厚傳》。疑卽拶、桚二字之譌。

桚字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
桚字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zǎn］
["Jiyun" at the end of the cut, enter the 曷, fine. ]
Same as "拶2".
One of the old tortures was finger-struck. Five small wooden sticks were connected in series with ropes, and they were put into the fingers of the victim and tightened firmly. Also refers to this instrument of torture.
[②]［zā］
["Jiyun" at the end of the cut, enter the 曷, fine. ]
Same as "拶1".
That is crowded.
Jun
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Addendum] [Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　 Jie; Kangxi Strokes: 10; Page Number: Page 526-21
[Vocabulary complement] The sound is not specified. Person's name. Song Shi gave Long Jun the name Zhao Huai'en. See "The New Compilation of Song History·Wang Hou Biography". Suspicious, 桚譌 are the two words.
